name: Turbo Jetrunner
description:
Won "Most Challenging Minigame" in the Gamemaker #Noticeme Jam. A solo project made in two weeks.

Outrun the man on your prototype Turbocycle by day, then blast off into the stars on the Jetrunner to shoot down monsters by night! Turbo Jetrunner is a super fast-paced arcade game that combines old-school racing and on-rails shooting, in that order, with a trippy pseudo-3D visual style.

The game that - somehow - took GXC by storm is now available to be downloaded for your Windows computer. If you use the Opera GX browser, play in browser here!

Keyboard controls:

  • Arrow keys to steer/move
  • c - accelerate/shoot
  • v - drift
  • x - turbo/bomb
  • z - brake (bike mode only)

Gamepad controls:

  • Left stick or pad - steer/move
  • Right shoulder button or trigger - accelerate/shoot
  • X (square on PS-style) - turbo/bomb
  • A (X on PS-style) - drift
  • Left shoulder button or trigger - brake (bike mode only

Drifting, turbo, and bombs all consume AP. To generate AP on the Turbocycle, ride at top speed. To generate AP in the Jetrunner, shoot enemies - every bullet that hits generates AP.

Turbo Jetrunner was made in two weeks for the Gamemaker #NoticeMe jam, and won "Most Challenging Minigame". It also, in less than a month, became one of the most played games on the service. I don't know how this happened - I blame the loud, obnoxious GIF that I used for a cover image.

Turbo Jetrunner is a solo project. All assets made by me, except for the fonts Upheaval and Edit Undo, both by Brian Kent.
